content: They wanna stretch it out in Minnesota? Let 'em. Not in New York 20. Democrat Scott Murphy, a businessman making his first race, has won the special election (held March 31) in New York's 20th Congressional District to replace now-Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D). All the votes are apparently in, and Murphy has defeated Jim Tedisco, the former state Senate minority leader, by 401 votes. Tedisco conceded the race this afternoon. In congratulating his opponent, Tedisco defended holding out until today: This was a closely contested election that perhaps lasted a little longer than anyone may have expected or wanted. But it was important for our electoral process and for the hard-working people of Upstate New York that it be resolved fairly and decisively. http://www.npr.org/blogs/politicaljunkie/2009/04/democrat_scott_murphy_wins_ny.html Now if only Norm Coleman would show the same intelligence and class and concede also.
reply: They wanna stretch it out in Minnesota? Let 'em. Not in New York 20. Democrat Scott Murphy, a businessman making his first race, has won the special election (held March 31) in New York's 20th Congressional District to replace now-Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D). All the votes are apparently in, and Murphy has defeated Jim Tedisco, the former state Senate minority leader, by 401 votes. Tedisco conceded the race this afternoon. In congratulating his opponent, Tedisco defended holding out until today: This was a closely contested election that perhaps lasted a little longer than anyone may have expected or wanted. But it was important for our electoral process and for the hard-working people of Upstate New York that it be resolved fairly and decisively. http://www.npr.org/blogs/politicaljunkie/2009/04/democrat_scott_murphy_wins_ny.html Now if only Norm Coleman would show the same intelligence and class and concede also.
title: Democrat Scott Murphy Wins NY 20 Seat; Tedisco (R) Concedes

content: quote: Originally posted by jdksfcret: They wanna stretch it out in Minnesota? Let 'em. Not in New York 20. Democrat Scott Murphy, a businessman making his first race, has won the special election (held March 31) in New York's 20th Congressional District to replace now-Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D). All the votes are apparently in, and Murphy has defeated Jim Tedisco, the former state Senate minority leader, by 401 votes. Tedisco conceded the race this afternoon. In congratulating his opponent, Tedisco defended holding out until today: This was a closely contested election that perhaps lasted a little longer than anyone may have expected or wanted. But it was important for our electoral process and for the hard-working people of Upstate New York that it be resolved fairly and decisively. http://www.npr.org/blogs/politicaljunkie/2009/04/democrat_scott_murphy_wins_ny.html Now if only Norm Coleman would show the same intelligence and class and concede also. Tedesco was right to hold out for a recount, and did indeed show class by graciously conceding and wishing Murphy well. You bet, Coleman has now reached the point of being an azz. Dave

In congratulating his opponent, Tedisco defended holding out until today: This was a closely contested election that perhaps lasted a little longer than anyone may have expected or wanted. But it was important for our electoral process and for the hard-working people of Upstate New York that it be resolved fairly and decisively. http://www.npr.org/blogs/politicaljunkie/2009/04/democrat_scott_murphy_wins_ny.html Now if only Norm Coleman would show the same intelligence and class and concede also.
reply: Tedesco was right to hold out for a recount, and did indeed show class by graciously conceding and wishing Murphy well. You bet, Coleman has now reached the point of being an azz. Dave
title: Democrat Scott Murphy Wins NY 20 Seat; Tedisco (R) Concedes

content: Congratulations to Congressman Elect Murphy. Just another routine, but also HUGE, victory for the Democrats proving once again the American people as a whole, no longer have confidence in anything Republican. Time to start listening to the Meghan McCain's of the world Republican's. Without doing so, you will be condemned to the extreme back-benches of Congress for a very-very long time. "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson

Wow, are you easily misled--but that's been obvious for some time now. A 400 vote margin is HUGE in a district that was already democratic?

content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: Congratulations to Congressman Elect Murphy. Just another routine, but also HUGE, victory for the Democrats proving once again the American people as a whole, no longer have confidence in anything Republican. Time to start listening to the Meghan McCain's of the world Republican's. Without doing so, you will be condemned to the extreme back-benches of Congress for a very-very long time. Wow, are you easily misled--but that's been obvious for some time now. A 400 vote margin is HUGE in a district that was already democratic? I'm pretty familiar with that district. Hunting and fishing for almost fifty years, and even spent one Winter working up there. It's a heavily Republican District. Up until Gillibrands victory, it always voted GOP. The Republicans expected to take it back. Any victory of a Democrat is a "huge" victory. Both sides poured money into the district. Dave
